summary: The Prototype to Production Act (S. 2135) amends Section 4022 of title 10 of the United States Code, modifying the use of other transaction authority (OTA) by the Department of Defense. It raises the monetary threshold for OTA usage for prototype or follow-on production contracts, restricts delegation of authority, defines key terms like "head of the contracting activity" and "follow-on production," and grants authority to award production transactions for rapidly deploying proven technologies to address urgent warfighter needs.
